info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:20AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern New Hanover and southern Brunswick Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 219 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Seaside to Carolina Beach. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Kure Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, Snows Cut, Ocean Crest Pier, Yaupon Beach, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Southport, Civie Town, Supply, Seaside, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus and Sea Breeze. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 8 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for southeastern North Carolina...and northeastern South Carolina.
